snippet: A bill to trim the deficit — hitting mostly programs for the poor — has no chance of becoming law, but could set the terms of debate in an election year.
abstract: House approves sweeping legislation to cut $310 billion from the deficit over the next decade; plan makes significant cuts to programs for the poor, shifting those savings to the Pentagon to stave off automatic military spending cuts scheduled for 2013; legislation has no chance of passage in the Senate.
lead_paragraph: A bill to trim the deficit — hitting mostly programs for the poor — has no chance of becoming law, but could set the terms of debate in an election year.

headline.seo: House Approves $310 Billion in Cuts; Senate Passage Unlikely
headline.main: House Approves $310 Billion in Cuts, but Passage in the Senate Is Very Unlikely
headline.print_headline: House Approves $310 Billion in Cuts, but Passage in the Senate Is Very Unlikely
